attributes.action: Create a people’s forest. Plant a tree for every life lost during the pandemic.
attributes.background:
Create a lasting, living memorial to those that have died during the pandemic. 
Although it may not be over, we could start to build something that literally brings life, habitat and clean air. Something positive and beautiful during this challenging time.
attributes.additional_details:
So many people have found comfort in getting outdoors during lockdown and appreciating the natural world. Many of us that live in cities would never get the opportunity to plant a tree. 
A tree is something that can outgrow and out live us and bring its joy to future generations. They are symbols of life and, as our climate changes, of hope.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/567615

attributes.action: Allow women suffering from endometriosis to have their eggs frozen on the NHS
attributes.background: I want women suffering from endometriosis to be considered for egg freezing prior to undergoing treatment and surgery to limit their chances of becoming infertile. Usually, the NHS will only fund egg freezing for cancer patients having treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Many women with endometriosis also suffer from infertility, causing more pain and heartbreak for the patient and their partners and wider family. Endometriosis is a chronic condition and currently, there is no cure. Treatments to manage symptoms include contraceptives, medically induced menopause, and surgery. Surgery can help the chances of conceiving naturally, but it is not always straightforward. Women should be offered the chance to freeze their eggs and preserve their fertility.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Fund NHS scheme for women with Endometriosis to freeze their eggs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579802

attributes.action: A National campaign aimed at lowering the cost of organic produce for all.
attributes.background:
When vaccines fail to keep step with mutations.
Our natural defence, the Microbiome, is under attack from the practices of Industrial farming. We need a network of small organic farms, distribution centres to support a national infrastructure directed to co-operative shops in our cities and towns.
attributes.additional_details:
With Inner-city youth facing unemployment and a growing housing shortage, a new workforce could be modelled and nurtured with all haste.
Suitable National land-banks should opened for these directives once developed, and a one off land tax should be levied on large landowners holding above 1000 acres in support of the national interest to find fair value and funding.
Failure to protect and increase our natural defences at this stage, will turn crisis into disaster without a long term view.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about current food production, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to implement policies to reduce the cost of organic food, such as subsidies for organic producers and a tax or other producers.

attributes.action: Make Sir David Attenborough a Lord.
attributes.background:
To elevate Sir David Attenborough from a Knight to a member of the House of Lords.
Where his knowledge, passion, wisdom and influence can help shape government policy and law making.
attributes.additional_details:
Sir David has been a national and global inspiration in the fields of climate change, nature conservation, ecology, education, pollution and environmental issues.
His impact and life long contribution deserved to be acknowledged at the highest level.

rejection.details: You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour at http://www.gov.uk/honours

attributes.action: Add mindfulness and meditation to the national curriculum
attributes.background:
Mindfulness and meditation is the first step to living an examined life and being able to be content. 

Our current system has been failing young people as it focuses solely on academics or vocations and not enough on the personal growth of young people’s personal growth.
attributes.additional_details:
Mindfulness meditation is a growing area in psychology and education.

Other countries have begun rolling out mindfulness courses in education as learning about the nature of ones own mind is a useful skill in all aspects of life, specifically education. 

Mindfulness has been linked to increased attention, memory, emotional stability and wellbeing, healthier relationships and mental health. It would be a practical and effective way to tackle the mental health crisis amongst young people.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554313

attributes.action: To hold a public referendum on confidence in Her Majesty’s Government
attributes.background: To hold a referendum as soon as possible which allows the general public to indicate whether Her Majesty’s Government retains their confidence or not, in light of its handling of the Coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: In light of the Coronavirus outbreak, many of the issues that the British public voted on in December 2019 have been sidelined. Given the severity and nature of the crisis Britain has faced and continues to face, the public must be allowed to indicate whether Her Majesty’s Government continues to retain their confidence in handling the pandemic and other national issues. The people have been asked to make many sacrifices over the course of this year: it is only fair the Government do the same.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or for a vote of no confidence in the Government.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a general election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557074

attributes.action: Save wildlife and trade - ban fishing in at least a third of our coastal seas.
attributes.background: Create zones in which fishing is illegal in at least one third of the UK's coastal seas. Protect these areas under a law to be named Attenborough's Law.
attributes.additional_details: Banning commercial fishing in coastal seas has been shown to be an effective way to protect wildlife and improve trade. Protecting the eco systems in coastal seas with no-fishing zones allows the wildlife population to recover, this leads to a higher fish population in areas where commercial fishing is permitted, which protects the fishing trade. As David Attenborough has stated, this could be the key to protecting both humanity and nature. No fishing zones Should be legally protected under 'Attenborough's Law'.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553334

attributes.action: Create environmental laws for UK supermarkets
attributes.background: We need supermarkets to act faster on sustainability. Supermarkets need to stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets have the power to change consumers’ habits and stop offering us produce that are destroying nature. We need to consume less but we need supermarkets to help drive that change and not offer us produce out of season from half way round the world. We also need to reduce waste and start conserving our planet’s resources. But we need to do it now.

rejection.details:
You want supermarkets to "stop importing goods from countries that are participating in mass destruction of biodiversity and only stock sustainable produce" but it is not clear how this would be assessed, or what would be classed as 'sustainable produce'.

You may wish to sign the following petitions which relate to similar issues:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320082

attributes.action: Support British Wool farmers and products made from British Wool in the UK
attributes.background:
Make it easier to purchase products made from British Wool in the UK with clearer labelling and promotion of natural fibres.
Take a stand and be far more vocal in support of natural fibres, with particular reference to British Wool.
Ensure that products are labelled clearly with place of origin.
attributes.additional_details:
British Wool is a very underused product of the UK farming industry. The prices for raw fleeces at present are below the costs of shearing and transportation to the Wool Marketing Board collection sites. Many farmers are burning their fleeces in the fields.
The use of products made from acrylic and polyester fibre are causing microparticles to pollute the whole planet. An active support for businesses who use British fleece for their products would be an huge financial and environmental help.

rejection.details:
You want the Government to 'take a stand and be far more vocal in support of natural fibres' but you don't specify what you mean by that.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to introduce tax incentives for clothing manufacturers which prioritise the use of textiles grown in the UK, if that is something you'd like to happen. 

You may also like to sign this petition which calls for 'All products sold in the UK to be clearly labelled with country of origin': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309019

attributes.action: Increase protection offered to hedgehogs under the Wildlife and Countryside Act
attributes.background: Increase the protection offered to the hedgehog under the Wildlife and Countryside Act by moving it to schedule 5, allowing the level of protection appropriate for such a keystone species in decline.
attributes.additional_details: The hedgehog the has been added to the International Union for the Conservation of Nature’s (IUCN) Red List for British Mammals. We want the government to take action to preserve this species and save it from extinction.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300100

attributes.action: Prevent the drilling of oil and gas on the Isle of Wight
attributes.background: The government should intervene to prevent the drilling of oil or gas on the Isle of Wight. Proposed plans would see exploratory wells dug with the potential for further drilling.
attributes.additional_details: Fracking/oil & gas drilling on the Island would be economically disastrous for the “holiday Isle” as the suggested sites are areas that welcome a high volume of tourists. Furthermore, the decision to further exploit natural gas & oil runs counter to the government’s position in facing climate change. Put simply, our government should not stand for further fossil fuel extraction and should instead seek to find alternative sources of energy.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a planning decision for the local council.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to ban oil and gas exploration in the UK, or in specific circumsatances (such as in internationally recognised biospheres) if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Postpone/cancel all PPEs (pre-public exams) for Year 12s this year.
attributes.background:
To cancel or postpone the PPE examinations that will take place in June/July this year for all of those sixth-form/college students that are taking them. 
Instead, like has been done with GCSE and A-Level exams this year, the grades that go to universities can be based off of teacher prediction.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, sixth-form students and those in colleges alike have missed out on significant time in school; leaving huge gaps in our education. These PPEs are what will determine the grades that will be sent to universities when we apply. Naturally, the majority of us feel exceedingly underprepared - many of us having been advised that these exams would not even take place.
We feel that by taking these exams with so little preparation it will jeopardise our future prospects.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards, individual schools and Ofqual, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570 

Exam cancellations and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here: 

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk/?gclid=Cj0KCQjwpfHzBRCiARIsAHHzyZq25dJRPEYEgu_Jsyh9e-Ehmx_IlSA1wM_dLnm-DFYTu_93cvsIoH8aAkB9EALw_wcB  

Children’s Society: https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/mental-health-advice-for-children-and-young-people/issues-affecting-young-people

Childline: https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Test population for T cells and immunity before offering a jab of any kind
attributes.background: Stop testing and forcing jabs - test first
attributes.additional_details:
At this time enough natural immunity is prevalent in the worldwide let alone U.K. populous - we don’t need to be jabbed/restricted/mandated-U.K. can lead the way-we need to see how many of us is already naturally immune [superior]-stop wasting money on any other tests/injections which are now above £130/jab-if in doubt give T cells/natural immunity testing…..

Enough real world data is in play now to see that natural immunity for under 50’s-old/vulnerable can have jab if wanted!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the current approach to testing for and vaccinating against covid-19, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There is already testing to assess the prevalence of antibodies against covid-19 (see, for example, this insight by ONS, based on testing for antibodies: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/healthandsocialcare/conditionsanddiseases/articles/coronaviruscovid19latestinsights/antibodies).

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Exempt people who recover from COVID19 (with antibodies) from the vaccine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/602031

attributes.action: RESTRICT THE USE OF FIREWORKS SO THEY ARE ONLY USED BONFIRE NIGHT AND NEW YEARS
attributes.background:
Stop the use of fireworks for birthdays, weddings etc
To let Fireworks only be used at relevant times of the year for BONFIRE night and NEW YEARS EVE only.
attributes.additional_details:
Even with their ephemeral nature, fireworks cause a lot of air pollution in a very short amount of time. ... A scientist told Forbes that when the fireworks go off, the metal salts and explosives undergo a chemical reaction that releases smoke and gases into the air.  As we are fighting to protect our ozone I feel that fireworks are adding to the problem of air pollution.
They only used to be used bonfire night and from 2000 new years eve.
It is also causing great stress to pets at home.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595560

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence and outlaw the dumping of raw sewage in rivers
attributes.background: The government must make it illegal for water companies to dump raw sewage in our rivers. It should be a crime to allow such destructive use of our water ways by these commercial enterprises.
attributes.additional_details: The government urgently needs to pass a law to stop immediately the dumping of raw sewage in our waterways. It’s destructive to nature and our beautiful countryside. It’s wrong on so many levels and a violation of government duties to be allowing this to go on.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599873

attributes.action: exemption from Covid vaccine if shown to have antibodies 6+ mths after infection
attributes.background: exemption from Covid vaccine if shown to have antibodies 6+ mths after infection. It is and against human rights to isolate people from work and travel abroad if they can prove they have immunity naturally from Covid and have antibodies.
attributes.additional_details: Enforcing a vaccine on people who do not need the immunity they have built up themselves

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to formally recognise the status of people who have recovered from Covid-19, but we're not sure exactly what you mean by "exemption from Covid vaccine".

Currently vaccination is only a requirement for people working or deployed in care homes. We could accept a petition calling for people who have recovered from Covid-19 to be exempted from this requirement. We could also accept a petition calling for the Government to make people who have recovered from Covid-19 eligible for the NHS Covid-19 pass, if that's what you want to happen.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Stop bury Lancashire  council  building  on our green belt listen  to  people
attributes.background: The bury Lancashire  council are going against  the people's wishes and building  on the greenbelt it outrageous that a council  of a few greedy councillors would go against  thousands  of protesters  and destroy out greenbelt it needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: We need the government  to step in and listen to the people  of bury Lancashire and save nature hedgehogs  foxes birds bees we need our greenbelt already  iv seen the eye saw mess on pilsworth bushes chopped  down piles of building  material a lot of wild life gone they want to do the same in walshaw and tottington bury Lancashire we do not want this to happen please stop it from destroying our countryside

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://www.lancashire.gov.uk/council/get-involved/petitions/

attributes.action: Add ‘proof of recovery’ from Covid as another entry requirement into the U.K.
attributes.background: Currently the government make those flying into the U.K. take a 2 day test on arrival as an entry requirement, however those with ‘natural immunity’ from recovery from Covid can not take a test for up to 90 days. Therefore proof of recovery should be added as one of the entry requirements.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to consider this as there are many people out there that are fully vaccinated that are now catching Coronavirus, and are being unfairly treated as they can now not travel for up to 90 days after recovery from Covid as they have to have a negative test on arrival and there is no option for those that have already recovered from covid. I believe the Government should accept proof of recovery as a way of entry into the U.K.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580974

attributes.action: Change in owning / keeping a non native exotic animals for commercial gain
attributes.background: Following recent media coverage around UK citizens buying / keeping / owning exotic animals that are not native to the UK (Tiger King Netflix and ITV’s Britain’s Tiger King presented by Ross Kemp) is not acceptable and inhuman.
attributes.additional_details: It is unacceptable for an individual to mimic a natural habitat for these animals in the UK. The licence to own / keep these type of animals is not acceptable and a change in the legislation is required.

attributes.action: Allow angling to commence during lockdown, no match fishing but pleasure angling
attributes.background: I want government and Parliament to allow angling as an individual sport to allow to continue during lockdown this will allow fishing tackle shops and suppliers to continue to open and offer the click and collect service.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing angling to continue as in previous lockdowns, not only does it support the economic recovery, but will help with mental health and well-being angling as a whole is a solitary sport and is  naturally social distanced, I am not asking for competition angling to commence.

rejection.details:
Under the national lockdown effective from January 6th, angling and fishing are still permitted activities, as long as wider guidance on social distancing and household mixing is adhered to. See Sport England's website for more information:
https://www.sportengland.org/how-we-can-help/coronavirus/return-play/frequently-asked-questions-national-lockdown-restrictions

attributes.action: Ever Arts - 'make Britain an orchard' initiative. Investing in british produce
attributes.background: Plant in the 70-80% undeveloped land, fruit, nut trees for produce and wildlife. The 'make Britain an orchard' initiative is just that. A boast of British produce when the government aims for 20% fruit tree coverage per 500 ache. A tithe of following for wildlife and also for foraging. Planting.
attributes.additional_details: Wildlife, environmental nurture, produce for nature and Britain's commerce. Make 'Britain an orchard' is a divert from European import. Cherry, walnut, apple, pear, hazel. Many different additions. For Britain's imports of fruit and nuts. Separated from Europe. It shows environmental support, appealing to public yet supporting British stability in produce in the mid to long term.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make the public use of fireworks illegal.
attributes.background:
Make- 
▪️The use of fireworks illegal to the public.
▪️The sale of fireworks to the public illegal.
▪️The manufacturing of fireworks for sale to the public illegal.
▪️It illegal to hold a group display of any nature without certified training and a license.
Punishment: Extremely heavy fines.
attributes.additional_details:
Yearly most of the public and their pets are suffering due to these excessively loud and needless explosives.
  In particular -
▪️Veterans who suffer with anxiety disorders  due to witnessing war. 
▪️People who own pets who have to witness their loved one experience absolute inconsolable fear. 
▪️Pets who have to endure the above.
▪️People and pets who suffer life changing injuries. 
▪️The fire service, NHS and veterinarians who are put under strain.
This petition has the intent to protect!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Establish a Natural Blonde Day
attributes.background: We would like you to raise awareness of the fact that the blonde population, due to having a recessive gene, is dying out.
attributes.additional_details:
We have observed that blonde people are becoming very rare to be seen, therefore we decided to go around and do research of our own. We found that most of those surveyed agreed fully and had noticed the same phenomenon.
Science shows that as we become a more global society the recessive blonde gene is being lost in the gene pool; which is a case for concern. To keep the variety of people, this fact needs to be acknowledged and people should be made aware of the decline in this demographic.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for designating specific days, such as this.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory sustainability indicators on food and product packaging
attributes.background: Due to increased pressures regarding biodiversity decline and loss of natural habitats, the government should pass law that supermarkets and product manufacturers display how sustainable their products are on the packaging. This could be in the form of an additional traffic light style guide.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless we act fast and educate the general public in an accessible and digestible way, we're going to run out of time and see the collapse of the natural living world. Such a small change to how food and consumer products are presented could have a dramatic, positive impact to consumer behaviour. 

Not only would the additional indicators hugely benefit our environment, they'd be likely to have positive economic impacts due to local UK products being favourable over unsustainable import goods.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549844

attributes.action: Recognise access to green space as a human right
attributes.background: Green spaces – with the mental and physical health benefits they provide – should be easily accessible for everyone. But this is not currently the case. 2.7M UK residents live over half a mile from a green space, with low-income and BAME communities most likely to suffer a deficit of local greenery.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government must declare access to green space a human right and take action to fulfil this right. This means protecting existing urban nature and increasing the volume of greenery in the areas where it is most needed (with pocket parks, street trees and biophilic architecture). 

COVID-19 has both awakened the nation’s appreciation for green spaces and exposed its stark disparities in access to them. We now have a chance to shape a healthier, happier and more equal society – let’s seize it.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like access to green space to be a human right, but we're not sure how you would like the Government to implement this. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as requiring planning laws to include a minimum amount of green space based on population.

attributes.action: Increase Environmental Protection and Green Focus in Covid-19 Recovery Plan
attributes.background: The government must enforce stronger environmental protection within plans for Covid-19 recovery. It must implement a green focus and invest in active travel, energy efficiency, renewable energy, nature tourism, wildlife and environmental conservation, and other green projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite declaring a climate emergency in 2019 the UK Covid-19 recovery plan has an overly strong focus on construction and development at the expense of protecting the natural environment.
Polls show a public preference for a change to the economy and a greener focus, which was promised but quickly forgotten. 
The UK has failed to meet the majority of climate action targets. 
It is our responsibility to protect the natural environment, especially after it has provided us with so many benefits.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues.
attributes.background: Ban disposable barbecues, these are a huge cause of forest fires and they are creating a litter problem. This is having an effect on our environment and is damaging our ever so important eco system.
attributes.additional_details: Our woodlands and forests are important and need to be protected. Trees provide so much for nature, they help to protect our environment and are important towards sustaining life on this planet.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Give all those Essential Key-workers a one of Thank you Tax free bonus.
attributes.background: A one off Tax Free Thank you BONUS.For all those Key-workers who whilst it is their main job have not been able to stay at home or work from home and have had to go out to work to keep the economy and the country running. Those include Care Workers, Lorry Drivers, Retail Workers & of course the NHS
attributes.additional_details: Those people who have not been able to isolate due to the nature of their job, (not including those who wanted to go to work but due to health issues were advised to stay home) need the government to say a better THANK YOU as they have not been in a position to work from home and i feel it would be nicer for you to show even more appreciation not just the NHS but all those who every day have put their lives at risk during the lockdown.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

attributes.action: Make the socialising restrictions enforceable instead of implementing a curfew
attributes.background: Please do not ban the daily exercise for law abiding citizens, instead require citizens to carry a self written paper with address, date and time, so that the police can enforce the law. If exercise is banned, then everyone will be deprived of fresh air, exercise and access to natural vitamin D.
attributes.additional_details:
Having seen Matt Hancock's threat in the BBC, I wanted to highlight the following issues:
1: This punishes law abiding citizens, whilst provide no solution for dealing with the violation. (As those who are ignorant will just continue being so)
2: Those of us who doesn't have supplements or a garden will be deprived of exercise, fresh air and access to free vitamin D. These are critical things for a functioning immune system. Make the current restrictions enforceable instead.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has passed new regulations which cover restrictions on gatherings, but individuals can now spend time outdoors, including to exericse, as often as they wish.

The Government's latest guidance is here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/staying-alert-and-safe-social-distancing/

And the most recent regulations are here: http://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2020/350

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Forbid trading to non essential business & services on Sundays.
attributes.background:
Our main concern is the effects on the environment but also we want society to restore their spiritual values and to have peace of mind. 

We should take the lesson of the coronavirus epidemic as an example of the benefits of having less people on the streets as this reduces pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to reduce pollution and there's no question about it. These days people can buy online so why do we need more people on the streets on Sundays.

Less shops means: less cars, trains, energy consumption, rubbish, noise, etc. This will allow the air to clean and nature to flourish better. 

This would also reduce accidents and the need for more police on the and emergency services on the streets. 

This would help to reduce stress on society.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310336

attributes.action: Shut all construction sites in London in order to stop the spread of COVID-19
attributes.background: Those most critical to our economy should not be discriminated against due to the nature of their trade. Forcing workers, many undoubtedly vulnerable, to resume commuting and working entirely undermines all measures in place – as upon returning home they will expose their families to COVID-19.
attributes.additional_details: More than 300,000 critically deemed construction workers are still having to commute into and around London via busy transport services, as they are unable to work from home. Our capital is the nucleus of this country’s COVID-19 crisis, where one third of our nation’s cases have been reported. Construction sites remain open, under instruction to impose ‘social distancing measures’ of which are as impossible and insignificant as standing 2 metres apart.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308933

attributes.action: Reintroduce wolves into the UK
attributes.background: We want the government to discuss reintroducing wolves into rural areas of the UK. Wolves should be integrated into our ecosystem.
attributes.additional_details: The establishment of wolves has a beneficial impact on our environment. Wolves are a keystone species scientifically proven to boost biodiversity diversity and carbon sequestration. They help to regulate deer populations naturally. Wild ungulates tend to be the preferred prey of wolves over livestock.

rejection.details:

attributes.additional_details:

attributes.action: Allow residents to use any means necessary to defend their property and family.
attributes.background: Allow people to protect themselves, their families and property in the event of forced intrusion / attack / burglary / robbery, etc. without fear of being reprimanded.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Common sense / logic
2. Criminals of the above nature do not require protection (based on their decisions / actions).
3. Law abiding citizens should have the right to protect themselves.
4. Restore faith in a revised judicial system

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about residents' rights to self-defence, however it is already the case that residents are permitted to use 'reasonable force' against intruders. There’s no specific definition of ‘reasonable force’ - it depends on the circumstances. The guidance on 'reasonable force' states that "If you only did what you honestly thought was necessary at the time, this would provide strong evidence that you acted within the law" meaning that a resident using 'any means necessary' could already be acting within the law.

It is therefore not clear how you'd like the law to change.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577568

attributes.action: Rename the official form of Governance of the UK from Democracy to Plutocracy.
attributes.background: We the people wish for the our official form of governance of the United Kingdom to be renamed from a constitutional democracy, to an institutional plutocracy, to more accurate reflect the current state of affairs.
attributes.additional_details: In order to accurately reflect the current political atmosphere in the UK, we the people feel it important that we accurately define what it is we stand for, as a country. rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.
